name: Patrick Nelson
text:
I think the pictures below pretty much speak to the quality you can expect from Woodland.  I've have tried calling their sales office, I was told to call corporate, I called corporate and got voicemail.

My house is about 4 years old.  Well out of warranty.  But, most of the poor workmanship appears after the warranty period has ended.  My master bath and entrance to our master bedroom has severe structural problems.  The cracks you see have been re-plastered and painted more than once.  Forget about doors closing properly.  The doors have been trimmed to such an extent that a new door will be required for the bedroom.  The framing issues you may have will not be covered by your warranty and will not appear until a few years after you own your home.  Once they do, you will find yourself spending a lot of money to repair.

If framing were the only issue, I probably would not write the review.  I never do this kind of thing.  But the electrical was done so poorly that it nearly burned the house down.  The left exposes copper to aluminum high voltage line exposed in a junction box.  The result was blowing out the double oven's control panel.  This resulted in an expensive repair to the ovens, but could have easily resulted in a fire.   Again-- the kind of thing that happens well after your warranty period has expired.

The problem I have with Woodland, is that their "quality" is only skin deep.  They have a great marketing staff, but once your in your house and a year has passed you are on your own to deal with the poor workmanship that lies just below the surface.  No builder is perfect.  But, it would be nice if they built to code.  I have more pictures if you are interested.

name: Joy Wink
text: We love Woodland Home! This is our second home purchase with them. They were professional and very organized through our home building experience. Thank you so much Woodland Homes Team! You are the best!

resp.text: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us!

name: Blake
text:
Let it be known that I’ve given Woodland over a year and a half to make themselves better before writing this review and they have continued to be just as much of a disappointment as they were since the day we closed.

First, don’t let them convince you to close and that your outstanding items will get fixed within 30 days. The sub-contractors don’t keep up with their warranty repairs and Woodland doesn’t follow-up with you after closing unless you are constantly in contact with them. Check my review of Custom Interior Trim to see just how their subs act and treat customers.

Their warranty team is an absolute joke. They don’t follow-up, they don’t coordinate, and if you aren’t keeping them in line, they just let your items slide off the radar.

They have shown a complete lack of professionalism ever since we closed. I will admit, we love the house itself. It’s good quality, the design process was fun, and we felt like the options they had to choose from were exactly in line with what we wanted, but the worst mistake I ever made was trusting that they would continue their great service after having closed on the house. If you don’t listen to anything else, just hear me when I say do NOT let them close on your house until they finish everything. It has truly been bad enough that I regret ever choosing them as a builder, no matter how much we do like the house itself.

And again, if I’m being completely honest, the staff that they have are nice people. I mean I have legitimately enjoyed dealing with most of their staff, but I’ve also had to do their job for them. I have to do all of the follow-up to make sure people are showing up to do their warranty repairs. I’ve had to coordinate with the warranty department and the subs to make sure they had all of the correction items listed.

It’s exhausting dealing with Woodland and their lack of support for Warranty customers. I’ve told them this multiple times, but if they would put just as much care into how they treat and deal with Warranty customers as they do with new customers still in the building process, they would be a nearly flawless business. Until then, they deserve this negative review and more. I’ve spoken with multiple people in my neighborhood who can corroborate this story and would say the same thing themselves. We have warned people we know away from Woodland specifically because of this and away from some of the specific sub contractors they use. Horrible customer service, dismal professionalism, and a demeanor that says “you as a customer don’t matter to us as much as the new build customers.”

resp.text:
Blake,

Thank you for the kind words regarding your home building experience with Woodland Homes. We are happy to hear that you had a fun experience and enjoyed our process of building. Next, we would like to say that we understand your frustrations with warranty. We are in fact struggling with time lines and subcontractors. At this time North Alabama and surrounding areas are experiencing a housing boom. This combined with the struggles of building a product in the midst’s of a global pandemic have made it difficult to obtain products for some of our customers warranty requests.

It is also difficult to keep subs motivated when they have so much work to choose from in front of them. This is just the honest truth, and the reality of the world we are living in.  That said we understand it is frustrating to wait on your items to be completed. While it may take us a little longer to complete a warranty item we are getting to all of our customers and completing their warranty requests. In fact, we have even extended specific warrantable items past the agreed upon 1 year term in order to ensure our customers are happy, and have their items completed .

Since we don’t know your full name there is no way to reach out directly. We would encourage you to call your onsite sales person and get them involved to assist you, or even call our corporate office and ask for the president of the company. He will be happy to work directly with you.

name: Dina Boley
text: Woodland Homes was outstanding building our home!  We loved the out of town service we received when buying from West coast.  The staff helped us every step of the way!  We love our beautiful home.  We couldn’t be happier!

name: Aisha Buycks Realtor (Huntsville Madison AL)
text:
Woodland Homes is a local builder who builds beautiful neighborhoods and homes. They are generally in a nature rich area and provide green spaces within their communities. Most neighborhoods start at mid $300K and go up. There may be a few neighborhoods available at a lower point.

Their process is pretty easy and they are Realtor friendly. Pretty much anything you could want they have the ability to make it happen. You are not limited on your customization as long as you don't price yourself out the neighborhood.

They offer a variety of available styles homes such as garden homes, townhouses, craftsmen bungalows, traditional style homes. Their level of quality in any home they build is generally Executive level. The offer and array of floorplans and amenities within their communities.

If you are in need of someone to assist you while navigating your purchase process with Woodland I am definitely available to help. You can click on my name to acquire my contact.

name: Matt Curtis
text: As an owner of a Woodland Home, Shayne Templet was very helpful in getting us information on our home to help us with a remodel. Thanks Shayne!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!

name: Dominic Simard
text: They built us our dream home!  Love the home, love the people, and love the company! Our 4,650 sqft home is quality.  No major issues.  True luxury home!  Lived in the home for over a year now.

resp.text: Dominic, thank you for letting us know! We are honored to have built your dream home. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do.

name: Cathy Olive
text: Working with Morgan on our house closing was a pleasure. She is very professional and kept us fully informed.  So far we are pleased with the overall craftsmanship and also enjoy the neighborhood.

name: Disappointed Home Buyer
text: The initial phase of the home buying process was great. The personnel in the home office were welcoming and professional. During the build I hired a home inspector who found major errors with the home. This information was relayed to the site manager and many of the errors were overlooked and I’m still dealing with them. Upon walking through my home I found basic issues with the craftsmanship that should’ve been addressed by the site manager, if he had completed a walk thru of the home. Once the home was complete a final walk thru was scheduled. I found the same issues as the last walk thru. At this point, if you don’t address the problem it’s often overlooked. I refused to sign for the keys. As a buyer I felt rushed to sign for the keys to the home, that wasn’t ready. I was promised the issues would be addressed in a timely manner, “I’M STILL WAITING”. I still have a page of outstanding issues with my home. As a premier builder I expected more. The subcontractors provided poor quality of work. No disrespect, but the attention to detail lacked, for my home. I hope no one has to go through what I did. I’m not sure if it’s due to the number of homes Woodland is trying to build or is this the standard issue with Woodland across the board. I didn’t want to come off as a complainer, so I asked around my neighborhood and many of us shared the same problems. This is not to bash Woodland. The homes, cosmetically looks great, I think more effort needs to be made to build a better quality home for the price and oversight of the subcontractors is a must. If this doesn’t happen hold the site manager accountable. The warranty department shouldn’t make people feel like they are the problem. The subcontractors need to do their job and provide a quality product. If I had to do it all again I would definitely ask around the neighborhood where I’m buying and meet one on one with the builder. The company should accommodate, people are spending a lot of money on these homes.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. We pride ourselves in our builders and customer service. If you would please call our office directly, we can address any of your concerns or questions directly. We are sorry to hear this but look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you again.

name: Vinson Moore
text: I have looked at Woodland Homes on Green Mountain, Huntsville Al. It actually defies logic that I could desire so much to live there, be impressed with what I saw, and have the experiences I have had. Maybe it is coincidence but I don’t think so. I will simply state what happened and let the reader decide. I have seriously looked at Woodland homes 4 times. The first experience was positive but I was afraid of the road in and out of the area so I decided not to buy. The last 3 times I had resolved that fear and wanted to purchase a house from Woodland homes. The first of these three, I spoke with an associate. He showed me a lot and gave me a price for a home on the lot. He said we had to see his boss. I did so and she literally panicked. She said he gave me the wrong price. I said ok and left. The second of these 3 times, Woodland homes sent me an email with an advertisement for a house already built. It was priced in the range we were looking for. We made an appointment with the aforementioned realtor and spent 30 minutes looking at the home. It had one feature we did not like but we were about to make an offer when she said oh no, this house has been sold. She added, but we can build you one like it on another lot. We spent a couple of hours looking at lots and found 3 we liked. She said she would send us the prices on all three. The result was that the lot we wanted was not available for the house we wanted to build on it and the other two had prices that were 40 to 50 thousand dollars more than the one we looked at. Not exactly the same price...The last time my wife met with a different realtor and got prices for several models one of which was built and the other almost completed. You have probably guessed what happened. I showed up with the checkbook only to find that all of the homes with quoted prices were much higher than documented on the plans provided to my wife. The one we really wanted was about $70,000 more. The other home already built was about 40,000 dollars more than documented on the plans.We left and will not return. The neighborhood looks great and maybe our experience is some kind of odd anomaly. Just wanted to share it. Good luck.

name: Anthony Shipp
text:
Just had a house built by them, The build to approximately one year due to weather restrictions. But that is not what this is about. The outside of the house is nice and for the most part the inside is ok.

However there are issues with the house that need to be addressed and my mother who has been handling the build for me since I can not be present can not get a hold of anyone. No call backs and no email back.

We are almost certain the HVAC is not connected in the office, the ladder into the attic is not painted or spackled so it is just bare wood, my mother had to paint the trim around the fireplace, and there is a window that still hasn't been installed. The back yard landscaping is terrible, there are so many ruts and holes in the grass that you can barely walk without something to hold onto. The front yard isn't much better.

I could understand a production builder but I would not have expected this from a company that supposed to be a premium builder. The attention to detail is lacking. An expensive production builder.

Update: 28 Jan 2020

Attic stairs still not finished and also realized that the bottom piece of molding is missing from master bathroom window. Also adjacent lots sold to another builder possibly bringing down the property value in existing homes.

I would never recommend building with Woodland and definitely will not consider if I have another home built in the future.

resp.text:
Thank you for your response. We have been in consistent contact with your mom through-out this process. We apologize that communication has been difficult with you since you have been out of country. This is the first we have heard of the HVAC problem, but we have now reported it our warranty department.
It is also not uncommon for a brand new yard of sod to have slight dips after being freshly installed. We are confident that your yard meets warranty guidelines, however, when you return and visit your home we will be happy to look it over again.
Lastly, our records indicate multiple email & phone traffic between the designated POC & the Woodland Homes team.
*Woodland homes appreciates all custom feedback. We are committed to offering a quality home with a one-year warranty in which all terms and conditions are clearly laid out at time of purchase*

name: James Ashbaugh
text: Woodland Homes has made our new home buying experience so seamless, personal, and enjoyable. Thanks to Shanye, John, Rayford, and the whole Woodland Team for all they’ve done to make this transition so great!

name: Tim F
text:
Been in the house as the original owner 6 years, have had multiple issues due to poor subcontractor work.  When a general contractor (Woodland) consistently picks poor subs and refuses to stand behind them, it makes me wonder how they can stay in business as long as they have.

We’ve had plumbing issues with the shower fixtures, roof leaks around the fireplace, and electrical issues with outlets that came loose from the wall.

The most recent is a completely preventable HVAC issue.  The coil sprung a leak after 6 years.  The sub neglected to register the unit, so instead of a 10 year warranty, the manufacturer only gives a five year warranty.  The bill is $2,000 thanks to the sub’s laziness.

Corners were cut at every turn leaving me to wonder what will fail next.  Very disappointed with Woodland, their choice of subs, and lack of accountability.  👎🏻

name: Kim Skaff
text:
Woodland Homes builds a beautiful home on the outside.  However, if you are looking for top quality and attention to detail, you would be better off with another builder. They build homes quickly - maybe too quickly as evidenced by some of the problems we have experienced.  After living in our home for two years, a light switch in our dining room which was not in use at the time suddenly sparked and popped and caused a breaker to blow.  I called an electrician who discovered that the wiring was barely connected which caused arcing and sparking.  He then checked a few more light switches and outlets to find that about half of them were loose and sloppily constructed.  I ended up paying for the electrician to inspect every light switch and electrical plug in my home. I have also had to replace wiring in the electrical box because of a humming noise.
When you build a home with Woodland, they schedule you for a one day marathon of dealing with the contract staff and their design team.  You must be prepared to make ALL decisions in one day.  Their design center has a limited number of choices and you have no time to research products. Don't assume that they offer quality products, either.  Price Pfister products were their plumbing choice at the time I built my home. Huge mistake.  If I had known how crappy this brand was, I would have insisted on Delta products. That goes for wood floors also.  I chose a "premium" product for an additional cost only to find after it started denting and scratching immediately that it was made out of a soft eucalyptus based engineered wood.  I have already replaced half of it with a nice Hickory engineered wood that has held up beautifully- even in high traffic.
I was not happy with either their ceramic tile selection or carpet choices but had no option other than to pick what I disliked the least.  Apparently, most of my neighbors did the same because we all have the same back splash.  I have already replaced carpeting in my bedroom because of poor wear.
This is not the first home that I have had built so it is not like I was expecting perfection.  However, it was expecting better quality than I received.

name: Brandon Harwell
text: i bought my house from the 1st owner so I don't have all the building materials.  I am building a detached garage.  I am trying to match the exterior of my house (brick, shingles, etc).  Trying to get in touch with them for that is impossible.  I called a few years ago to get paint colors so I know they keep records.  Calling now is pretty much a waste of time.  They have a different girl doing it now.  Her voicemail states that it could take up to 24 hours to return call and that email would be quicker.  When I called for brick type it took 3 weeks and I sent an email.  THREE WEEKS!  My fault for forgetting to get shingle type, but now my contractor is ready to shingle my garage.  It has been 24 hours since I left a voicemail.  I have sent 3 emails and left 2 voice mails.

name: Ted Mercia
text: I have found Woodland Homes to be very well organized and a professionally operated company. The staff and management surpasses all others I have come in contact with. I will definitely use Woodland Homes in the future for my real estate needs and recommend it to anyone.

name: Martha Hawkin
text: I would definitely recommend the services of Woodland Homes of Huntsville. Their work is always done so well. They are well known in the area for doing a great job.

name: Natalie K
text: I was most satisfied with John and how he was attentive and made sure that he did all he could to work with us during the loan process. The overall experience with Woodland has been great and we have appreciated it.

name: Becca Hogan
text: Woodland Homes of Huntsville was fantastic work with. The did a great job for us and the finished result is better than expected. I highly recommend.

name: Lulu Houston
text: Woodland Homes of Huntsville is great to work with. They always provide top quality work to their customers. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

name: Pat Chapman
text: We really like Tony for helping us to design the perfect custom kitchen we have always wanted. He provided us with a lot of information that was very detailed and much appreciated.

name: Frank Bailey
text: I have found that Woodlan Homes to be a very well organized and professionally run company. The staff and management are the best I have ever worked with. I will definitely use Woodland Homes in the future!

name: Natalie K
text: I was most satisfied with John and how he was attentive and made sure that he did all he could to work with us during the loan process. The overall experience with Woodland has been great and we have appreciated it.

name: Ingrid
text: Living room and tub not spacious enough

name: Matt Pierce
text: Woodland Homes of Huntsville made our home beautiful and we deeply appreciate the effort and time our Realtor put into our home. Martha was excellent throughout the whole process and she is a huge asset to their team.

name: Alan Anderson
text: My family and I wanted to personal thank Mike and Martha for all of their hard work throughout the home buying process. Mike met us over the course of the year and had a beautiful vision while Martha was our first impression of Woodland and it was an excellent one!

name: Angela Moore
text: The staff at Woodland Homes of Huntsville was all very professional and courteous. Bruce Stone was great to work with. Woodland has a great reputation in the market.

name: Christian Brady
text: My home built by Woodland Homes is absolutely beautiful and I get outstanding compliments on it all the time! The staff is respectful, very courteous and exceeded my expectations.

name: Joan Einer
text: We have now been living in our home for about a year and we are still extremely grateful for the amazing job everyone did. Every detail Woodland Homes found for us in our home is a characteristic that seems it was made just for us.

name: Ingrid
text: Living room and tub not spacious enough

name: Will Baker
text: The HVAC service Woodland Homes of Huntsville provides is outstanding. Our realtor originally highly recommended them and we now have a beautiful home.

name: Elizabeth Blair
text: Woodland Homes of Huntsville is an awesome company. The customer service is unbelievably great!

name: Crystal Preston
text: Your worker out on the road was driving like an idiot! He was behind me at a stop sign and decided he was going to make the left hand turn at the same time as me and I almost hit him! Then he speeds down Capshaw passing cars in the turning lane.

name: Brandi Burns
text:
BUYER BEWARE!!!! After your one year warranty do not expect them to help out. After being in our house for 2 1/2 years my floors are pulling apart (all of the down stairs I can put quarters between the cracks), I have a leak around my chimney(all the silicone is cracked), our HOA is now going to be responsible for a 400K loan which was used to build a pool and clubhouse (sold as part of the amenity package), the back half of the neighborhood is now front entry garage all because Woodland can and will do these things to make a buck and does not care once you have purchased the house.

After speaking with someone at Woodland about the leak in my Chimney I was told to contact the people they use to install these but Woodland would not pay for it. At this I asked why and was told "if we fix yours and word gets out we will have to fix everyone's". I now have damage in one bedroom and all my insulation is wet.

As for the floors the only response I get is Wolde put those in and from Wolde I get Woodland rushes us to put them in before they can acclimate to the house. What a run around and hassle you do not want to deal with.

name: Gloria Ross
text: We did refer some friends and now they are building a house with you in. I think that says something about our experience with Woodland Homes of Huntsville.

name: Manuel GR
text: Beautiful homes

name: Heidi Piedra
text: They are very nice people who work here.

name: Scott Stafford
text: The best metal building for the money. Great personal service throughout the construction process.

name: Kaneida Patrick
text: Okay

name: Tiffany Chapman
text: I HAVE NOT BEEN HERE!!!!

name: Bill Koehler
text: Very good service and knowledge for all Pools and Hot Tubs. Honest and thorough service department, which unfortunately is difficult to find these days. Fully custom pool builders. They also service Hot Tubs not purchased here.

name: Shannon Lambeth
text: I HIGHLY recommend using a DIFFERENT company. This company is terrible. My wife and I just bought a home and it already had an in ground pool. I called this company, spoke with a very nice and informative woman only to be given the wrong information. I was told for my pool opening they would come check my system and make sure everything worked properly, remove the cover, pour chemicals into the water and clean and vacuum the pool for $325. Upon arrival, they were here about 15 minutes, checked nothing, poured two things into my pool, only for it to still be green 3 days later. I have yet to receive any information as to what my bill is, what they did, next steps, etc. I called the company to ask when they would be back to clean and was told they won’t be coming back and if I wanted them to clean, it would be $150 extra. They also did not install the ladder or check my equipment, as I realized there are two leaks and a gauge not working. I told the woman who scheduled it that I was unhappy with my service and felt like I didn’t get what I paid for and was told I would get. Her response wasn’t, “I’m sorry for the misinformation, we will correct this immediately” nor did she offer some sort of refund. She basically accused me of lying and said, “sorry you feel that way.” This company does not care about their customers, only the profit. If I would’ve known I was paying for them to come take the cover off and pour two things in my pool and not even make sure the water would clear up, I would’ve NEVER agreed to this. Do not use this company, they will let you down and treat you like you’re just more money.

name: Bob Brasher
text: Johnson Pools installed an in ground salt pool and spa with water feature. The grout in the spa continues to fall out even though they did re-grout once. The problem is they put about an inch space at the top before the first row of tiles. There is too much space and the grout cracks and falls out. They also installed a Pentair system that controls everything. I’ve had multiple ongoing issues with this system. My lights do not work properly. I can’t control the feature with my phone app. I have to go to the equipment and cut it on and off manually. Currently the spa won’t come on at all by using the app and you can’t turn it on manually. The maximum temperature on the spa will just reset itself for no apparent reason. The light in the spa is bad and won’t change colors. They said they would replace it but it has been about a year and it hasn’t been replaced. They have one service person and he seems capable but stretched very thin. He solves one problem but then another will appear. Something is up with the Pentair system but no one seems to know how to fix it. We paid more to use Johnson Pools because at one time they had a good reputation for quality and service. I must say this has not been my experience. I spoke with one of the owners and she was borderline rude in the phone and I still have several unsolved issues. I couldn't recommend this company in good conscience.

name: Nathan Goldsmith
text: I have been working on a hot tub repair project and they have been extremely helpful in buying parts for it. I am glad I have a Sundance hot tub so I can shop local for parts and be able to ask questions regarding different issues that arise.

name: Debbie Vickers
text: Very helpful with chemicals and my pool

name: DeeAnn Kizziah
text: So very helpful!  They had in stock half of what we needed.  The other half, a part for my spa, was researched by staff to see if they could get it for us.  I didn't even have to ask them to do this!  Customer service at its finest!

name: Lauryn Mcnair
text: Very nice and  friendly answered all my questions!

name: Dawn P
text: Exactly what I needed. Staff helpful. Quickly in and out.

name: Paul Christian
text: Better if they would build me a water feature like they have in their showroom.

name: Susan Slagle
text: It was a pleasure to deal with Cathy Castle when I needed parts for our sand filter.  She was knowledgeable,  friendly and went out of her way to locate the parts we needed.  The price was right, the parts were perfect and I intend to call Johnson Pools first when future needs arise.  I will definitely recommend her and the company to any friends with pool problems.

name: Lateshia Seay
text: The service was exceptional. I told them my issues. The walked me through the solution to my problem step by step so I could understand what to do. I recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you so much :)

name: Robert Hayden
text: Johnson pool has a very courteous and knowledgeable  staff and they have what you need in store.

name: Matthew Houston
text: I can't say stay away from this place strongly enough. They are OK if you just need chemicals but if you require any sort of service steer very clear. It took them a year and a half to get us a pool cover. It took at least 4 fittings and them requiring more drilling of anchor points even though they took our old cover that fit perfectly to use as an example. They constantly blamed their vendor for their mistakes and lied to us to not take ownership of the problems. They will consistently not complete their pool opening and closing checklists. Totally unprofessional. I welcome any rebuttal from the management and I'll be happy to share the email chains.

resp.text: Mr. Houston, I was aware of some of the problems that existed but certainly not all of the ones you have listed. I apologize for all the inconveniences we caused you. It should not have happened. I will research it further. Thank you for your input and post such as this helps us to find our weaknesses.

name: Joshua Harris
text: Great customer service

name: Brittany Wray
text: Super friendly and knowledgeable sales staff! Free water testing and they tell you exactly what you need to put in, how much, and explains the reasoning behind it so you don’t feel like they’re just trying to make a sale!

name: Kimberly Greene
text:
My landlord recommended Johnson's to open our pool. They charged us $325 to open. Ok, no big deal. I get a call the day after they came out saying they couldn't "finish opening up the pool" because whoever closed the pool last sawed off the handrail and ladder. and estimated a bill of over $1000 of repairs. ok so I let the homeowner and agency deal with that. Both of whom were dragging their feet of course.
Turns out there were no repairs needed. I had another pool company come out to price and finish opening. All they had to do was stick the handrail in the holes. And my friend and I fixed the ladder ourselves. So $1000 worth of estimates repairs that aren't needed.
I called Johnson to see about a refund because all they did was take off the the cover, and after about three weeks the pool still looked bad. Kacy told me they completed the opening so I was still responsible for the entire bill. I asked then how come you told me y'all couldnt finish until the railings were fixed? Literally the only thing the workers did that first day was remove the cover and turn on the pump, and put in the first round of chemicals.
She seemed to get defensive about me trying to understand why i had to pay for an entire opening when they weren't coming out to finish the opening until who knows when. I should have only been charged for half, or they should have withheld the bill until it was finished. it's not like we could swim in it until then anyway.
Due to Kacys wording about the "cant FINISH until..." yet still charging full price, I would not use or recommend them to anyone.

name: Leah Bailey
text: Way to high in price! Shop around you will find great pool company’s for a lot cheaper.

name: GRASSLAND RANCH
text: Horrible customer service. Pool liner 3 weeks late. Day after day no one communicating with me. When I called and asked if we should leave the vacuum running that the tech hooked up to suction the liner they were rude. I mentioned the installer said the liner may be measured wrong because there were wrinkles. The owner Penny J said well you’re there what does it look like? I said ma’am I’m not the professional it’s not completely installed so I don’t know. She said “well you should be able to look at it .” This is just the beginning. I would not recommend them. They were friendly until they took my money and not a second after that.

resp.text: Unfortunately liners are conducive to weather and temperature and the installation is based on weather. If you experienced problems we are very sorry and it was not intentional. We apologize for your bad experience with our company.

name: Cynthia Patterson
text: Always very helpful.

name: Charles Chereek
text: Good place to get your pool and spa chemicals, accessories and hot tubs!!!

name: Aaron Brown
text: Friendly ,knoweble staff. They have been very helpful with my pool

resp.text: Thank you for spending time to write this review, We are so happy that we can provide you with the parts, service and products you need for your pool and spa. Thank you for your patronage and future business! We strive for customer service and professionalism and we are looking forward to serving you for MANY years to come.

name: Alura Young
text:
I was at Home Depot today getting some 2x4's for a shed that my husband and I are building. He was at home working on the shed so it was just me. Two gentleman volunteered to help when an employee said it may be a few minutes before someone would help me load it into my truck.
They put the wood in the bed, I said thank you and got in my truck to drive off.
I noticed they had a HUGE load of lumber to put into their own truck and noticed there was a business posted on their truck so I drove past to get the name.
Any business that has employees go out of their way to help random citizens are good with me!
Thank you again. I really appreciate it!

name: Jean Honyotski
text:
I ordered a liner from them and was told 4-6 weeks for delivery and install . It took over eight weeks for the installation.
The new liner installation was a disaster.
Listen up potential liner  buyers..... this could happen to you.

There was a sharp rock  left under liner by my stairs.
When the pool light  is turned on at night in the pool you can see at least 30 + lumps (many of them large) on the floor of my pool and the walls also.
I called to complain and am told Tommy, the owner “is working on it “. Then im told they would send the installer out.
They tell you what you want to hear, to get rid of you. I called asking to talk to Cassie, I’m told she’s not there, I call right back and surprise ..surprise she  IS actually there, they avoided my call.

I’ve got pages of texts saying he’s on his way, we are working on your problem.  He will be there Monday night, minutes later I’m on the phone with the installer who tells me he’s not coming
The installer tells me he will TRY to fit me into his schedule. What a joke !!!!!!

The installer  never came, when I talked to him personally he didn’t know anything about the lumps under my liner, didn’t know why he was supposed to be coming to my house. Needless to say he didn’t come
The whole process from start to finish was bad and they left the floor of my pool a disaster.
Save you money and go someplace else .

name: Wayne Ebenreiter (Mister E)
text: Great service, reasonable price.  Had a liner replaced in my inground pool.  The service department was freindy and knowledgeable.  The installation crew was clean a respectful of my property. On such a small job  I never expected Tommy the owner to come out. He not only came out but he walked me through the process and told me what to expect.  I would highly recommend Johnson's for any pool needs.  I am a customer for life.

name: Donald Kelley
text: Excellent help and water testing of pool and spa water

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review.  It is always a pleasure to serve our customers and providing them with the information and chemicals  they need to maintain their pools and spas.

name: Joe Stevens
text: Always a friendly experience.  And their advice is spot on for our pool.

name: Frank Fosdick
text: Called looking for a person to install a above ground pool. They would not help, because they said it was against company policy.  They are just talking money out of that person pocket.

resp.text: Good morning, Frank. Unfortunately we don’t have any installers, we are retail only for above ground pools. We were not trying to not help you, our sales person you spoke to was indeed following company protocol. If you have questions please call us at 256-533-3188 and have a blessed day!

name: Collis Sims
text: Good, professional service. Really the only helpful pool place in town.

name: H P
text: Just post your prices on the website. Had to sit on hold to talk to a salesmen who could only tell me they go from $5200 to $22000. No details and couldn’t even tell me why I would want their tub over a $3000 one.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to post this review, I’m truly sorry that we weren’t able to fully explain the major differences between our exclusive Sundance Spa lineup and a spa that cost $3000. I would love to talk to you more about hot tubs and the benefits of owning one of ours.  I would agree with you on not posting or showing our prices, we ARE making changes to our showroom and looking to bring a better website experience to you.  If you are still interested in hot tubs, I would love to send you over some material that would show you everything that Sundance Spas has to offer. If that’s something you would consider, feel free to email me at Charles@johnsonpoolsandspas.com. I’m more than happy to assist you with all your hot tub needs and desires...Once again, I’m truly sorry that we couldn’t provide you with the information you were seeking but I hope in the future, we have the chance to show you what we are all about.

name: Theresa Weir
text: I like the store and people just prices are high

name: Brian Kessinger
text: Their sales staff is friendly, but the service manager is not so much. I would recommend going elsewhere for service.

resp.text: So sorry that you experienced the problems with our service department. We apologize for any inconvenience we might have caused. It is never intentional that we are unkind to any customer.

name: Devera Hester
text:
I can't give negative stars or I sure would. I have been waiting since I believe Nov for a mystery part for a hot tub that the service tech said he had at the shop. He left and never came back, I called a couple weeks later and was told by the service manager that it was my job to have placed a service call when the tech left my house that day...did not realize I was now an employee of Johnson Pools! I guess since I didn't place a call that day the part he had got shipped out somewhere else and they now had to order another for me. A couple weeks later I take it upon myself to call the tech directly (since I'm now an honorary employee of Johnson's) and he informs me he will be at my house after lunch and will call me when he's 30 minutes out...great. At the same time I'm on the phone with him, I'm getting a voice mail from the service manager telling me the part didn't come in and it will be a couple more weeks...wth??? How can he be coming out to my house with no part???? My gut tells me the part was needed for a more important job and mine was reordered again and this time is....wait for it, ON BACK ORDER!!!
My advice, there are other pool companies in this town

name: Deborah Stevens
text: Pool water testing,  very friendly knowledgeable staff

name: John MacDonald
text:
I asked for a pool opening and in return I got my pumps turned on (yes, a switch), a $7 pressure gage I didn't ask for, and a $195.00 dollar invoice. They charge for services not-rendered and then act bullish and naive. "We took off your pool cover" (I don't have a pool cover). They take exception when you call them out on their deceptive and incompetent practices acting indignant and offended. They assume that they are a good company because they've served the Northern Alabama area for "over 41 years." I interpret that as, "they've  gotten away with negligible service while over-charging for 41 years." I'm disgusted and do not recommend this company to anyone, for any reason. In business due to lack of competition. Criminals don't always wear masks, and this review isn’t an assault - although clearly insulting to the recipient - it’s my appraisal of their operation.

And if there is a reply to my review below from them, I assure you it's shallow and worthless.

name: Ellen Holden
text: They put in my in ground pool. They are so nice and helpful. My pool looks great.

name: Heather Whitmore
text: Great customer service, friendly staff, decent prices, love the free water testing!

name: Chipper2733
text: Almost 11 years ago we bought an above ground pool from Johnson.  We paid for it months before it was installed -- keep this fun fact in the back of your mind -- and seemed super easy and hassle free. Walked in the store, told the salesman we were looking for the largest above ground pool we could get that would be about 5 feet deep. He was super helpful, because we also admitted we knew nothing about the specifics, dimensions, or details; just what we wanted. We ordered and paid for a 27 foot round, 52 in walled, extended liner package.  We were also, originally,  getting a hot tub.  However 2 months after the purchase we found out we were having a baby, so we opted out of the hot tub, and stayed with just the pool.  3 months after that, pool installers brought the pool and did their thing.  My wife was concerned when they finished because the over lap liner was 6 inches from the ground in places, but they convinced  her that was what an overlap liner was supposed to look like. It took her about 3 weeks to actually get in the pool (when it was finally warm enough) and then she just cried. It was 3 and a half feet deep at its highest point. She drove her very large, pregnant self down to johnson pools and spoke with the original salesman.  He very shortly told her they have no affiliation with the installers, and there was nothing Johnson Pools could do to make it right, because it wasn't their fault.   Wife said her blood pressure got so high she thought she was going to have the baby at their store. Fast forward to the end of the first summer -- when we ordered a winter cover (obviously from a different place, the last time to step foot in the showroom she almost birthed a baby on their floor and swore them off for good)  we learned it was a 24' pool. 😲. Now, here we are, over a decade later, ready to replace the liner and find out THE WALLS ARE 48 inches tall. How much did we over pay for what we have?!! I'm still disgusted with the whole thing,  and have gotten in the pool MAYBE 5 times in 10 years.  My wife says every year we open the pool and the kids are taller she just gets angry all over again. We're 10 years late leaving this review, so our apologies if anyone else has had an equally horrible experience.

name: Darlene Carpenter
text:
Worst customer service ever from the service manager. We had a pool liner installed last year. Not even two weeks after install it sprung a leak. I called and  explained the situation, we had been left a warranty card but the serial number was not put on it. The Service rep said no worries she would take care of it ASAP get back to me on delivery... several days went by and no call. I contacted her again and stressed we were having a Birthday party and needed the pool up and running. She promised to get back to me. I called her two days later... She isn’t there has gone on a mission with her parents. So I start all over with someone else. He calls me back! It gets delivered early! Yeah we are going to have time to get it up and running and won’t have to have go with plan B for the birthday girl. The installers are great guys and get the new liner installed! Yeah!! They leave and we start filling! It now Saturday and we have lost two months of Pool time! We go get salt to get this thing going... Monday I call her back and let her know we are looking good and ask about the chemicals and the expense. I explained we had already gotten salt. No worries she says, bring in a sample we will get you what you need and give you credit. Ok that seems fair. I take a sample down, they give me algaecide and other chemicals, When I go to check out hey have to get her since I should be credited.  She has the cashier comp the stuff, I ask her what about the salt I have already purchased? She says she will give us store credit for the qty we bought. Ok that works for me!  Fast forward to last week. I go to the shop and get algaecide and shock to get the pool up and running for the year. I explained I should have a credit and the tech finds my account so he goes to talk to her... a few minutes later they come back. She bellows at me “You don’t have any credit with us! The last thing on your account was the $95.00 credit for the chemicals we gave you to get your pool up and running.”
I reminded her of the conversation we had. “You are wrong!” She says, you should have requested the salt the then” “I said had I known I would have.
I turned to the tech and said Thank you I will not be purchasing these items today.” I never raised my voice or was rude or condescending.
She continued to berate me as I started to leave the store. She says “you haven’t bought anything from us in  a year!” I said we haven’t needed anything... She goes on and says “You have to be buying something!”
At that point I said well it certainly won’t be here again, have a wonderful rest of the day 😊” and left the store.

Now mind you every other person I talked to at Johnson’s has been really nice! I will not be recommending them to anyone. They are not true to their word and are rude for no reason.

name: Jeff McKinney
text: A great place to shop for Big Green Egg supplies. The only negative is that they do not accept Am Ex. Otherwise a great locally owned place to do business for grilling accessories, pool supplies and outdoor furniture.

name: jill cattaneo
text:
AFTER 12 YEARS OF ALMOST DAILY USE OUR ALTIMAR SPA FROM JOHNSON POOLS NEEDED TO BE REPLACE, I CHECKED SEVERAL OTHER DEALERS AND THEIR "SPECIALS" AND  DECIDED TO  RETURN TO   JOHNSON POOLS AND SPA IN HUNTSVILLE AL , AND PLESANTLY SAW GREG THE STORE MANAGER WHO HAD SOLD ME  OUR 1ST SPA THERE, HE WENT OVER EACH OF THE SPAS AND INVITED ME TO TRY OUT ONE IN PRIVATE IF I SO DESIRED, I KNEW PRETTY MUCH WHAT WE WERE LOOKING FOR,  THE SPAS HERE HAVE THE BEST WARRANTY I HAD SEEN AFTER SHOPPING AROUND AND THE SPAS ON THE FLOOR WERE PRICED TO MOTIVATE ME TO MAKE "THE DEAL" WE LOVE! LOVE ! LOVE ! OUR CHOICE.. WE CHANGED MODELS AND WENT WITH THE LOUNGE CHAIRS AND FOOT MESSAGE AND WATERFALL   AWESOME!  WILL BE BACK IN TEN FOR THE NEXT ONE! I ADVISE TO CHECK OUT THIS PLACE AND TALK TO GREG BEFORE YOU MAKE YOUR PURCHASE ANY WHERE ELSE , THESE SPAS MAYBE A BIT HIGHER IN PRICE, BUT BELIEVE ME, YOU DO GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!
THE CATTANEO FAMILY

name: Daniel Burton
text: When I walked in, there was no one around. When one appeared, they were unable to answer my question and the second person was not very polite

resp.text: Not sure what your question might have been and we are very sorry for your bad experience. We make every attempt to treat every customer with kindness and respect. Please feel free to call my cell at 256/990-9416  and I will be more than happy to discuss this further. Penny Johnson

name: Clarence Ragland
text:
On August 27, I visited Johnson Pools and Spas to order a panle for my Hawthorne 680 to replace damage done on moving to Huntsville. Johnson Pools and Sap ordered the replcaement, and told me they would notify me when the panel arrived, usually in about two weeks.

Well, two weeks pass, then three, not notification, no panel. So I called them, and was told the panel had arrived and they were going to call me when I called them (a likely story). They made an appointment to deliver and install the panel, and lo and behold, the panel is the wrong color!

It was September by then, the workers too a portion of the damaged panel back to the store to ensure the right color was ordered, and I haven't heard a thing since, and it's November 11th as I write this. I plan to contact Johnson Pools and Saps and let them know in no uncertain terms that I am totally dissatisfied with they way they have conducted business in the case; which is basically no response to the customer at all!

name: Vanessa Kacer
text: Wow—having trouble with my above ground pool and looking for someone in the area to help. When I called, they refused to even give me the NAME of someone who could help me since I didn’t buy the pool from them. Complete unnecessary. I know where I will NOT be returning for my future pool needs.

resp.text: Very sorry you had this experience with Johnson Pools & Spas. Unfortunately we do not recommend other installers. That is a policy we implemented several years ago because people can get a bad experience and hold us accountable for the actions of our recommendation. We apologize for the inconvenience.
